meanings.definition: Distempers (noun): a derangement of the bodily functions
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with distempers after observing irregular bodily functions.
meanings.sent2: The cat's distempers caused it to have trouble walking and eating.
meanings.sent3: The circus clown joked that his distempers made him juggle like a clumsy elephant.
meanings.sent4: The storm's arrival brought distempers to the peaceful town, disrupting daily life.
meanings.sent5: The old book described a potion that could cure even the most severe distempers.

meanings.sent1: The messy room distempers my sense of order and cleanliness.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise distempers the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: Trying to cook and watch TV at the same time always distempers my focus.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news distempers the carefully laid plans for the party.
meanings.sent5: His constant interruptions distemper the flow of the conversation.
